info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 9:13AM CDT until April 8 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Nashville TN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee...
Duck River Near Hurricane Mills affecting Humphreys County.
For the Duck River...including Hurricane Mills...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Duck River near Hurricane Mills.
* WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Portions of Tumbling Creek Road east of Highway 13 are flooded to a depth of 2 feet and may be impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 21.7 feet and steady. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage this evening. It will then rise above flood stage late Sunday morning to 23.0 feet early Monday morning. It will fall below flood stage again Monday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 315 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING
